intro: Erigeron javanicus, commonly known as the Java fleabane, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist environments such as wetlands and marshes, and it has slender, hairy stems. Its flowers are usually white or pale blue, with ray florets surrounding a central disk of yellow tubular flowers. Erigeron javanicus is often used in traditional medicine and has ornamental value in gardens.
